intro: Cyrtandra infantae, commonly known as the Hawaiian baby cyrtandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the island of Maui in Hawaii and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded forest habitats at low to mid-elevations. Cyrtandra infantae is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species. Its conservation status highlights the importance of protecting native Hawaiian flora.
